events.name: "Small Creative Entrepreneurs and the Space of New Economies: Rochor Case Study" @Urban Lab
events.description:
Entrepreneurs from the Rochor+ neighbourhood in Singapore engage in dialogues on the ground in this panel focused on the impact of small creative entrepreneurs in activating the social, economic and cultural life of centrally located urban neighbourhoods. 
FAQs 
1. What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
By public transport, the nearest MRT station is Tanjong Pagar MRT Station. Please use Exit A and walk along Peck Seah Street.  
By car, you may park at the URA East Wing car park. Please use the lift to access the link bridge on the second floor. Follow the signs for Singapore City Gallery, and take the escalator to the first floor.    
2. Is my invitation transferrable? 
Yes, in the event that you are unable to attend you may nominate someone to take your place. Please kindly inform the organisers. 
3. Do I have to bring my printed invitation to the event? 
No, you do not need to bring your invitation to the event.
events.location: The URA Centre, Atrium, 45 Maxwell Road, Singapore 069118
events.group_name: Urban Redevelopment Authority and Singapore-ETH Centre

events.name: Manpower Hackathon
events.description:
Ministry of Manpower invites you to the Manpower Hackathon taking place from 6 to 8 February! If you are passionate about making an impact on local and foreign workers across Singapore, join us at the hackathon to demonstrate how you can help solve these challenges.   
Whether you are a developer or designer, researcher or entrepreneur, HR professional or safety and health expert, come, meet and work with other like-minded people at MOM’s first open innovation event.   
The themes you will be tackling at this hackathon are: improving engagement with workers; designing the Next Generation Work Pass; and driving excellence in Workplace Safety and Health. Want to learn more about the issues? Come to the Pre-Hackathon Workshop on Tuesday, 13 January to dive deep into the hackathon themes. 
  
PROGRAMME HIGHLIGHTS 
• Introduction to themes by MOM representatives 
• Panel discussion on the challenges and opportunities in worker engagement  - Dr Tan Lai Yong, Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy  - FAST (Foreign Domestic Worker Association for Social Support and Training) 
• Panel discussion on the challenges and opportunities in WSH and Risk Management - Seet Choh San, President, Singapore Institute of Safety Officers - Don Wilson Paua, WSHE Manager, Woh Hup - Lucy Tan, Chief HR Officer, Natsteel - Dr Goh Yang Miang, Assistant Professor, Department of Building, School of Design and Enviroment, NUS 
  
EVENT DETAILS 
Date: Friday to Sunday, 6 to 8 February 2015 
Time: 6.30 - 9pm (Fri) / 9am - 6pm (Sat) / 9am - 5.30pm (Sun) 
Venue: 237 South Bridge Road 
   
MORE INFORMATION 
Find out more about the Manpower Hackathon here.
events.location: 237 South Bridge Rd, 237 S Bridge Rd, Singapore 058786

events.name: Imagining the Future
events.description: Saturday 7 February, 2.30pm – 4.30pm Presented by Forum for the Future Expression Gallery, Level 4 FREE Imagining the Future An afternoon of fascinating talks exploring what the future may look like in Singapore and beyond, with opportunities for questions and discussion. This session is developed by Forum for the Future in partnership with ArtScience Museum. Featuring four speakers who bring different perspectives on the future: • Veerappan Swaminathan, Co-founder, Sustainable Living Lab • Tong Yee, Co-founder, The Thought Collective • Prof Dr Peter Edwards, Director, Singapore ETH Centre • Michelle Lim, Founder, Co-Founder of Awaken the Dragon The session will be chaired by James Goodman, Director of Futures at Forum for the Future.

events.name: Drone Fun Inaugural Meetup
events.description: Update (5/Feb): Have updated the location - thanks all for the suggestions, the park near the Marina Bay Gardens looks like a good spot for medium-sized to larger drones. Google StreetView: https://www.google.com.sg/maps/@1.275692,103.863506,3a,75y,330.97h,72.25t/data=!3m4!1e1!3m2!1sY6H4Rno1LFC5FzZPNZDiCQ!2e0?hl=en Make sure your batteries are charged, and bring spares! Forecast is for light winds with a slight chance of rain - suggest bringing an umbrella just in case! See you Saturday! ----- Bring your drones and let's have fun! Open to suggestions on activities / challenges, but here're are some ideas (still figuring out rules to keep it safe for our drones!): 1. Oval course racing, 1 on 1 and/or fleet 2. Obstacle course time trials (fly through hoops etc...) 3. Drone 'basketball' - 1 on 1 fly through the hoop before your opponent to score points Don't forget to bring all your spare batteries, and chargers, and bringing cold beers also encouraged! N.B. This is all 'weather permitting', if the weather looks sketchy, then we'll relocate to somewhere nearby for coffee or something... I'll post an update earlier on in the day if it's a NG. N.B. This is a privately organised event and not a commercial venture. All participants participate at their own risk and liability.
events.location: Park NE of Marina Mall, Marina Mall / Marina Boulevard, Singapore

events.name: Succeeding with Digital Orthodontics
events.description:
Succeeding with Digital Orthodontics Stratasys, Dental Axess, QuantumLeap, and 3Shape are proud to invite you to an evening of Digital Orthodontics.  The world of orthodontics is changing and the number of orthodontists and laboratories going digital is increasing rapidly. During the evening, you will learn about digital impression taking, digital model storage, treatment analysis, treatment planning, treatment simulation, digital appliance design, case management and 3D printing. The event will be held at Q&M Dental Centre in City Square Mall. There will be a bus taking the participants from Marina Bay Sands (venue of the AOSC) to the dental centre.  Hosts 3Shape is a leading industry pacesetter and provider of 3D scanners and CAD/CAM software for dental professionals in clinics and labs. Stratasys is a leading global provider of 3D printing and additive manufacturing solutions. Dental Axess provides the Australian and New Zealand markets with a wide range of digital dental solutions. QuantumLeap is a leading provider for high quality dental equipment and accessories in Singapore.    
Program 6.00 pm - 7.00 pm: Registration, buffet and refreshments 7.00 pm - 7.10 pm: Welcome 7.10 pm - 9.00 pm: 3Shape’s orthodontics solutions by Rudy Labor, Application Specialist (Orthodontics), 3Shape 3D Printing for orthodontics by Dr Stephen Ong, Dental Associate Director, APJ, Stratasys The Whole Tooth Approach - High quality 3D orthodontic treatment solutions using state-of-the-art CAD/CAM technology by Ari Sciacca, Lab owner/Director of Archform Orthodontics,  Australia   
Speakers Rudy Labor is Application Specialist for 3Shape’s Orthodontics solutions. He has been with 3Shape for four years, and focuses exclusively on ortho. Before joining 3Shape Rudy Labor owned a lab in France. Rudy Labor has trained 100s of professionals around the world in how to benefit from digital orthodontics.  Dr Stephen Ong currently serves as the Dental Associate Director for Stratasys Asia Pacific and Japan. He received his Bachelor of Dental Science from the University of Western Australia and Masters of Business Administration from the University of Melbourne, Melbourne Business School. He has worked in private dental practices in Australia and Singapore and most recently was engaged with a large dental supplies company with a focus on clinical consumable products. Ari Sciacca is the owner of Archform Orthodontics in Australia. Archform Orthodontics is at the leading edge of orthodontic technology and serves orthodontists around the world. Ari Sciacca, has had a keen interest in digital technologies and has used them in his laboratory for more than ten years. Today, he uses 3D scanners, 3D printers and various orthodontics software. Archform also receives digital impressions from some of the orthodontists that they work with. 
 Welcome!
events.location: Q & M DENTAL Centre, City Square Mall, 180 Kitchener Road #b1-13/14, Singapore  208539
